meanings.definition: A flatfish found in European waters.
meanings.sent1: I saw many plaices swimming gracefully in the European waters.
meanings.sent2: The chef prepared a delicious dish using fresh plaices caught in the European waters.
meanings.sent3: The plaices in the European waters decided to have a swimming competition for fun.
meanings.sent4: The plaices in the European waters were like hidden treasures waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The shimmering scales of the plaices in the European waters caught the sunlight beautifully.

meanings.sent1: She found a cozy plaices to sit and read her book in the park.
meanings.sent2: The map showed the exact plaices where the treasure was buried.
meanings.sent3: The cat claimed the warmest plaices by the fireplace as its own.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, the knight can move to different plaices on the board.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut floated in zero gravity, unsure of his plaices in the vast universe.
